Html:
Radioman, is it possible for GMAP to use local (on local hard disk or LAN) GIS data only in the form of Shapefiles or GIS data in MS SQL, thus no online downloading from Google etc ?

Thanks

OD
you can use your server as ImageCacheSecond so downloading from global servers occurs only once

Is it thus not possible at all currently to avoid the initial download as we have a full dataset ?

Alternatively, do you think it would be worth my while to to attempt to change the source components to achieve this (thus to use a "caching server" only type of option) ?

Option 1:

Avoid the download of map data from an internet source through appropriate settings so that only the locally available GIS data is used

 

Option 2:

Change source to achieve Option 1

 

If Option 1 is not doable currently, is Option 2 practical within a reasonable time frame in your opinion ?

i use triple cache in my company, first as default global servers(google/etc), second local network server(empty by default), third local sqlite cache(again by default enabled), i there is no data locally on computer, it searches on local server(if found caches locally), if no download from global servers and cache on both local server and local cache, so other clients gets data from local server instead of global servers if they do not have data already locally ;} so there is Zero overload for global and local servers, maximum performance ;} works well
